alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 04 at 4:46AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Clay, southeastern Randolph, northwestern Calhoun and northwestern Early Counties in southwestern Georgia through 530 AM EST... At 445 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fort Gaines to 10 miles northwest of Blakely. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Gaines, Edison, Shellman, Bellville, Bluffton, Harrisons Mill, Zetto, Carnegie, Moye, Fountain Bridge, Goffs Mill, Shivers Mill, Ferrell Crossroads, Martins Crossroads, Kolomoki Mounds Sp and Suttons Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
